result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized.  Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact, directly or indirectly, with RGA or JDA. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

AMENDED 12-08-2015 TO ADD RESTITUTION AS DETERMINED BY THE COURT.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 2/11/20:  Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.  **AMENDED 03-26-2020:  Defendant's conditional time is STAYED effective immediately due to COVID-19 emergency measures.**

2 years until 11-20-2023

02:07 PM  Court Reporter:  Hannah Wronkowski   DOC Agent Crystal Evans appeared in court.  Defendant Christopher A Weber in court.    

Statement by DOC Evans - Defendant has only paid $75 towards restitution, supervision has been extended two prior times for lack of payment. 
Statement by Defendant Weber requesting payment plan or civil judgment to help pay off the balance. He has found full time employment at Knight's Inn for the last month. 
BTC: Extend probation for 2 more years until November 20, 2023 with the same terms and conditions - full time employment, pay restitution, following directions from the DOC. Civil Judgment was denied. Court wants to see payment plan in the next month set up by defendant. Defendant has an appointment with DOC 11-11-2021 @ 10 AM. If defendant doesn't appear for his scheduled appointment by 10:30AM, DOC needs to contact the Courts to issue a warrant.

02:02 PM Defendant Christopher A Weber in court with attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels.  Defendant Christopher A Weber in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent Nicole Holtz appears in court.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  Agent Nicole Holtz does not appear.  This matter had been put over for SPD to appoint an attorney.  Atty does appear with the defendant.  BTC:  120 days conditional time is requested by DOC.  Defendant is to participate in the in jail, AODA treatment program.  The balance of the time would be used by the agent for enforcement purposes.  Defendant has not started the AODA program in the jail.  
BTC:  Amend JOC:  120 days RCJ conditional time is granted.   Defendant is to serve 30 days to participate in the AODA program.  The balance of the time is to be used for enforcment purposes.  Defendant is to receive CFTS from the day that the hold was imposed.

Lori Kuehn
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim RGA (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   No contact with the victim JDA (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Christopher A Weber in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Christopher A Weber in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
